title: No drama: Scheffler adds The Open, 3rd Slam leg
content: Scottie Scheffler captured the third leg of the career Grand Slam, cruising to a four-stroke victory in the Open Championship for his fourth win in a major.

title: Sights and sounds from the final round of the Open Championship
content: Check out some of the best moments from the final round as Scottie Scheffler tries to win his first Claret Jug.

title: Ole Miss freshman Adams, 18, killed in shooting
content: Ole Miss freshman defensive lineman Corey Adams was killed Saturday night in a shooting outside a residence in Tennessee.

title: Bryson rallies from T-144 into top 10 with final 64
content: Bryson DeChambeau, after an opening 78, finished off his Open Championship with a 64 to earn a seventh top-10 finish in his past 11 starts in a major.

title: Pawn shop owner admits to fencing Burrow items
content: A New York City pawn shop owner has pleaded guilty to buying and selling luxury items stolen by a national burglary crew whose victims included Cincinnati Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow, according to the U.S. Attorney's Office in the Eastern District.

title: Montgomery: Lions face 'year of reckoning' in '25
content: David Montgomery said the Lions are "tired of being close" to winning a Super Bowl and declared the 2025 season as a "year of reckoning."

title: 'Really sorry' Clark leaves ban future to Oakmont
content: Wyndham Clark hopes to play again at Oakmont Country Club but says that decision is up to the historic golf club after it banned him from its property for damaging his locker at this year's U.S. Open.

title: Garcia breaks driver in anger on No. 2, cards 68
content: Sergio Garcia played most of his final round at the Open Championship without his driver after he slammed it into the ground in frustration on No. 2 and split it in half.

title: Alonso out of lineup; 353-game streak at risk
content: Mets first baseman Pete Alonso, who has appeared in a franchise-record 353 consecutive games, was held out of the starting lineup due to a right-hand contusion.

title: WNBA stars wear 'Pay Us What You Owe Us' shirts
content: WNBA All-Stars took the court for warmups wearing T-shirts that read "Pay Us What You Owe Us," a reference to the players' biggest gripe during the ongoing CBA negotiations.

title: 💎 Eagles' Super Bowl ring has pop-out wings
content: The Eagles' Super Bowl LIX rings feature a hidden button that, when pressed, extends the wings on either side, revealing coach Nick Sirianni's saying, "You can't be great without the greatness of others."

title: Can the Rangers' offense be fixed? Five numbers that tell the story of Texas' lineup woes
content: What happened to the mighty 2023 World Series champs? Here's why the Rangers have gone off the rails.

title: Inside the Vikings' creative plan that saved J.J. McCarthy's lost rookie season
content: A knee injury kept the No. 10 pick off the field, but McCarthy spent the season preparing in unique ways to be the 2025 starter.

title: From Kevin Durant's Team Durant to Carmelo Anthony's Team Melo, these next-gen AAU stars got next
content: NBA stars such as Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony sponsor their own high school AAU shoe-circuit teams.

title: From Cooper Flagg to Trae Young: Stars who have showed out at Peach Jam
content: Before these stars went to college basketball and the NBA, they showed their stuff at the Nike Peach Jam.

title: UFC 318: Poirier retires, Holloway impresses and the prelims are ... must-see?
content: Max Holloway and Dustin Poirier set the bar high for finale fights, even after the undercard showed out.

title: Pacquiao wants to fight again: Can Romero or Mayweather be next?
content: Manny Pacquiao wants to fight again, and he has a few ideas for his next bout before the end of the year.

title: Euro 2025 quarterfinal talking points: Berger's wonder save, semifinal predictions
content: The 2025 UEFA Women's European Championship is on to the semifinals. But what stood out for our reporters?

title: Five overreactions before 2025 NFL season: Commanders win NFC East? Chiefs lose AFC West?
content: Is the Bucs QB destined for a massive new contract? Will the Commanders own the NFC East? We're judging offseason overreactions.

title: AFC North: Ravens to three-peat? Rodgers to snap Tomlin's playoff skid?
content: The division is loaded with intrigue and talent, from Lamar Jackson to Joe Burrow and, now, Aaron Rodgers.

title: Timeline: Caitlin Clark's injury-riddled first half of the WNBA season
content: Three separate injuries have sidelined the Indiana point guard and All-Star for 10 regular-season WNBA games.

title: Núñez scores 14-minute hat trick in Liverpool win
content: Darwin Núñez scored three goals in 14 first-half minutes for Liverpool as they beat Stoke City 5-0 in a behind-closed-doors friendly on Sunday.

title: Sources: Utd close on Mbeumo before U.S. tour
content: Man United are hopeful of completing the signing of Bryan Mbeumo in time to be part of their preseason tour of the U.S., sources have told ESPN.

title: Carter subject to racist abuse at Euro 2025
content: England defender Jess Carter said she has been subject to racial abuse during Euro 2025 and will step back from social media as a result.

title: Gabriel: This year will be different for Arsenal
content: Gabriel Magalhães revealed he signed a new contract with Arsenal because he believes "this season will be different" in the club's pursuit of trophies.

title: Messi scores 2, sets up 2 as Miami routs Red Bulls
content: Lionel Messi had two goals and two assists to lead Inter Miami CF to a bounce-back 5-1 win over the host New York Red Bulls on Saturday night in Harrison, New Jersey.

title: Source: USMNT's Sargent close to Wolfsburg move
content: USMNT forward Josh Sargent is on the verge of joining Bundesliga side Wolfsburg for a deal worth in excess of €21 million, a source has told ESPN.

title: USWNT's Rodman returns to training with Spirit
content: United States forward Trinity Rodman returned to training with the Washington Spirit on Saturday for the first time in three months.

title: Sources: Rashford close to Barcelona loan move
content: Marcus Rashford is on the verge of a seasonlong loan move to Barcelona after Man United gave permission for him to open talks, sources told ESPN.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United try to gazump Arsenal for Gyökeres
content: Manchester United have made a last-ditch attempt to steal Viktor Gyökeres from under the noses of Arsenal. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: From Skylar Diggins to Eric Gordon: Ranking Indiana's top high school hoopers since 2000
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of Indiana based on high school career achievements.

title: MPs of DMK’s allies demand office space in their constituencies
content: They allege that they are being forced to rent buildings and are unable to meet the people and discharge their duties

title: Tejashwi seeks support from Opposition and ruling parties over SIR in Bihar
content: In the letter, Mr. Yadav says the ongoing SIR in Bihar has shaken the very foundation of democracy through large-scale disenfranchisement

title: FIR against fake investment firm misusing name of Premji Invest
content: There is also an android app named PREMJIEX on Google Playstore and several WhatsApp groups under the same name, which is suspected to be created by the same fraudsters

title: DMK treating Vanniyar community as mere vote bank during elections: Anbumani Ramadoss
content: He charges Chief Minister M.K. Stalin with betraying the Vanniyar community and alleges that he has been lying about State governments not having the power to conduct a caste census

title: INTUC asks Centre for invitation to tripartite meetings, blames Air India crash on privatisation
content: Congress trade union calls for the establishment of cooperatives to protect workers against exploitation by platforms and asks why no FIR registered or punitive action taken in Air India crash case

title: Upendra Kushwaha urges CM Nitish to transfer JD-(U)’s responsibility to his son Nishant
content: Mr. Kushwaha expressed apprehension that delay in transferring the responsibility can cause irreparable loss to the party asserting that perhaps such a loss which can never be compensated.

title: ‘A useful tool’: annual share of abstentions in India’s U.N. votes at all-time high
content: Abstentions provide emerging and middle powers like India the opportunity to express themselves more freely, rather than merely going along with the consensus or voting against it, says former Permanent Representative of India to the U.N. T.S. Tirumurti

title: Over 58% Dalit voters in Bihar think unemployment is biggest poll issue: survey
content: The survey was conducted and released by the National Confederation of Dalit and Adivasi Associations also found that more than 27.4% Dalit voters in Bihar have ‘no trust’ in the Election Commission

title: Congress leaders detained in Jammu as police foil street march for J&K Statehood
content: Congress accuses J&K police of “manhandling” Rajouri MLA Iftkhar Ahmed; calls for probe into police action; during Monsoon Session of Parliament, INDIA bloc plans to raise demand for immediate restoration of Statehood

title: Centre to form multi-sectoral team in Himachal to assess disaster vulnerability
content: Team to comprise experts from NDMA, IITs, CBRI, and other institutions; Shah cites rising frequency of natural calamities in the State

title: Renovation of KSRTC’s Ernakulam bus stand on cards, say officials
content: The agency had been at the receiving end of public ire over the shoddy condition of the bus stand complex and its premises, which get waterlogged even after a brief spell of rain; the renovation works are expected to be completed in another 10 months

title: Tigress, tigress burning bright
content: From January to June this year, at least 22 people have lost their lives in Maharashtra’s Chandrapur forest circle to human-wildlife conflict. With 347 tigers in the area and each not having sufficient space due to urbanisation, forest officials say they can only increase surveillance and warning systems. Snehal Mutha reports on the relationship between the people who live there, the tigers, and the government

title: Tamil Nadu prepares panel to appoint the next Director-General of Police
content: The list of 8 eligible officers is expected to be dispatched this week. In the order of seniority, DGPs Seema Agrawal, Rajeev  Kumar, and Sandeep Rai Rathore top the list. All the three officers have had a stint in the Central government on deputation

title: Inaction of ISRO leadership in extinguishing spy case controversy remains a mystery, says former Ambassador T.P. Sreenivasan
content: T.P. Sreenivasan releases Chaaram: Chaara Caseinte Pinnamburam, a book by journalist John Mundakkayam on espionage controversy

title: Congress leaders signal that their patience with Shashi Tharoor is running low
content: They appear to ratchet up their criticism of the MP for “recurrently adopting a pro-Prime Minister Narendra Modi line” on foreign policy, national security, and also allegedly towing BJP line about the then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi’s alleged role in the “excesses” during the Emergency

title: Andhra Pradesh liquor scam: my son will come clean and prove the rulers wrong, says Peddireddi Ramachandra Reddy
content: Alleging that the NDA government is harassing Midhun Reddy, the Punganur MLA accuses Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, HRD Minister Lokesh and Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan of hatching a conspiracy

title: Be curious, creative and critical in thinking,  Cognizant co-founder tells IIT graduates
content: Lakshmi Narayanan urges IIT Tirupati students to be original, value-driven and socially conscious; JSW Chairman Sajjan Jindal highlights role of youth in realising ‘Viksit Bharat’ vision

title: Cattle traders in Maharashtra to launch boycott amid ‘harassment’
content: Members of the Muslim Qureshi community condemn the violent attacks on cattle and meat traders and transporters by gau rakshaks; community body has announced an indefinite trade boycott from today and has also met the DGP seeking police protection for members

title: Punjab police busts BKI terror module linked to grenade attacks in Patiala
content: Three arrested for targeting police posts; foreign-based handlers identified, further attacks were allegedly being planned

title: TDP will seek discussion on ‘A.P. liquor scam’ in  Parliament, says MP Sri Krishna Devarayalu
content: It warrants a serious debate considering the scale of irregularities and money laundering that has allegedly taken place in the conduct of liquor business during the YSRCP rule, he asserts

title: Andhra Pradesh government scouting for suitable land for proposed Lulu mall in Vijayawada
content: Three locations under consideration as ₹1,222 crore project gets SIPB nod, say officials; opposition mounts over use of APSRTC land

title: Quadcopter loses connection during training sortie, falls in open area in Ambala
content: The Army authorities and Air Force personnel also reached there. They took the drone into their possession

title: Chief Minister calls on Governor, raises slew of issues
content: The meeting marks the first formal interaction between the Chief Minister and the Governor since the ‘Bharat Mata’ controversy flared up

title: Tribal man dies allegedly after Congress’ ambulance-blocking protest in Vithura
content: CPI(M) workers take out a protest march to the residence of Leader of the Opposition, holding the Congress responsible for Binu’s death

title: Jagadish Shettar says internal conflict is weakening Congress govt. in State
content: D.K. Shivakumar left the stage after his speech at the Sadhana Samavesha indicating that everything is not right within the Cong. govt., says BJP MP

title: Centralised monitoring system for street lights in Thiruvananthapuram city nearing completion
content: City Corporation piloting a project to install QR codes on electric posts so that public can scan and report directly to authorities if a particular street light is not functioning

title: Farmers appeal for payment for paddy procurement
content: In a memorandum to Agriculture Minister P. Prasad, farmers’ forum says that 33,327 farmers in the district were yet to get the money for the paddy procured from them three months ago.

title: Prioritise national interest over politics, V-P Dhankhar tells parties
content: The Vice-President has made the remarks amidst Opposition parties’ demand for a detailed discussion in Parliament on Operation Sindoor and U.S. President Donald Trump’s repeated claims of brokering peace between India and Pakistan during the recent conflict

title: UIDAI to roll out biometric Aadhaar update for children through schools in phased manner
content: Over seven crore children yet to update biometrics; UIDAI testing technology for school-based enrolment

title: Sangeetha Nataka Akademi all set to open its own bookstall
content: Minister for Culture Saji Cherian is scheduled to inaugurate the bookstall on the Akademi premises on Monday.

title: ISRO Chairman unveils plans for India’s space station by 2035, moon landing by 2040
content: V. Narayanan outlines India’s bold vision in space exploration, highlighting milestones like the Aditya mission, docking success, and upcoming Venus orbiter, as the nation positions itself among global space leaders

title: Education vital to achieve empowerment, says Nellore MP
content: Vemireddy Prabhakar Reddy assures to provide support to the youth hailing from backward communities and setup MSME units

title: Glimmer of hope for residents of Uralagallu in Sagar taluk: Mescom proposes to supply power to the village
content: The residents settled in Uralagallu six decades ago, after they were displaced by the construction of Linganmakki Dam.

title: Jharkhand High Court delivers split verdict on death sentence given to 2 Maoists in murder of six policemen
content: “Though both Constables Lebenius Marandi and Dhanraj Maraiya were witnesses to the occurrence, they had not seen the convicts participating in the mayhem,” Justice Mukhopadhyay observed

title: Mumbai advocate moves Supreme Court against Raj Thackeray over ‘anti-Hindi’ remarks
content: The petitioner alleges incitement of violence and hate speech, seeks criminal proceedings against the MNS chief for his alleged remarks targeting Hindi-speaking citizens in Maharashtra. Mr. Thackeray made the remarks in public speeches opposing the State government’s resolution to make Hindi the third language in State schools, he says

title: Two Himachal brothers marry same woman adopting tribal tradition of polyandry
content: Polyandry tradition in Himachal Pradesh’s Hatti tribe sees two brothers marrying one woman, showcasing unique cultural practices

title: Campaign to free campuses in Ernakulam of drug menace to be launched shortly
content: The campaign will help students who have been found using drugs by providing them with medical treatment and counselling to bring them back to life

title: Goa Governor-designate Ashok Gajapathi Raju calls for decency in political discourse
content: He expresses concern over the growing use of offensive language in politics, especially while criticising opponents

title: Trade of obscene videos: Cyber patrol squad gathers details of suspicious social media accounts
content: One of the suspects who allegedly traded such obscene videos on an instant messaging application has already been arrested in Kozhikode district

title: Civil service aspirants told to prioritise self-preparation more than coaching
content: Reading books, following UPSC toppers and proper planning can help crack civil services examination, says UPSC 11th ranker Sai Shivani

title: Aurad MLA terms complaint against his son a political conspiracy
content: He names the former Union Minister and fellow BJP leader Bhagwant Khuba as the mastermind behind the campaign against him

title: Jagan condemns arrest of MP Midhun Reddy in Andhra Pradesh liquor scam case, calls it political witch-hunt
content: The liquor scam is a fabricated narrative designed for media theatrics, says Jagan Mohan Reddy, and alleges that the three-time MP has been falsely implicated in the case through coerced confessions

title: Dog attack: Mumbai man held after pet pit bull mauls 11-year-old; laughs in viral video
content: In Mankhurd, Mumbai, a 43-year-old man named Sohail Hasan Khan was arrested after his pit bull attacked and injured an 11-year-old boy. Khan allegedly released the dog on the child, who was playing in an auto-rickshaw, resulting in injuries to the boy's chin. He was released after being given notice.

title: J&K Cong netas detained as police block rally seeking statehood
content: Jammu and Kashmir Congress leaders, including Tariq Hameed Karra, were detained by police during a planned "statehood march" in Jammu. The protest aimed to demand the restoration of J&K's statehood, revoked after the abrogation of Article 370. Undeterred, the party announced a 'Delhi Challo' program to protest at Parliament, supported by INDIA bloc MPs.

title: Quit Instagram: Perplexity CEO warns about job market reality; suggests do this instead
content: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas advises young individuals to prioritize mastering AI tools over excessive social media use, emphasizing that AI proficiency will significantly enhance employability. He acknowledges the challenges of adapting to rapidly evolving AI technology, which changes every three to six months.

title: Amarnath Yatra: 18th batch of pilgrims leaves from Jammu base camp to Kashmir
content: The 18th group of Shri Amarnath Yatra pilgrims has departed for the holy cave. A total of 4,388 devotees left from Jammu in two batches. One batch went to Baltal, and the other proceeded with 2,815 pilgrims. The annual pilgrimage began on July 2 and will end on August 9.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Nitish Kumar Reddy ruled out of England Tests
content: In a massive blow to the Indian cricket team, Nitish Kumar Reddy has been ruled out of the ongoing Test series vs England. It is understood that the all-rounder travelled with the team to Manchester but didn't take any part in optional training session at Old Trafford.

title: Govt gets 'SOS call' on China's 'Leave India' order to engineers and technicians
content: India's electronics industry is sounding alarms over China's alleged informal trade restrictions, fearing a crippling blow to its global competitiveness and a $32 billion smartphone export target. The ICEA, representing major manufacturers, claims China's actions deliberately undermine India's manufacturing rise, causing delays and increased costs.

title: ‘Unjustified and illegal’: Rosneft slams EU’s sanctions on Nayara Energy
content: Rosneft has condemned the EU's sanctions on Nayara Energy, its Indian affiliate, deeming them unjustified and a threat to India's energy security. Rosneft argues the sanctions are extraterritorial, politically motivated, and disregard international law.

title: Koneru Humpy creates history, becomes first Indian woman to enter FIDE WC semis
content: Koneru Humpy made history as the first Indian woman to reach the FIDE Women’s Chess World Cup semifinals, securing her spot with a draw against China's Song Yuxin. In another quarterfinal, Harika Dronavalli and Divya Deshmukh's match went to a tiebreaker. Vaishali Rameshbabu exited after losing to Tan Zhongyi.

title: Pakistan humiliated! Crumble to lowest T20I total
content: Bangladesh dominated Pakistan in the first T20I in Dhaka, securing a convincing seven-wicket victory. Taskin Ahmed and Mustafizur Rahman's exceptional bowling restricted Pakistan to a paltry 110. Parvez Hossain's brilliant unbeaten 56 guided Bangladesh to a comfortable win, giving them a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Whenever I get an answer from AI, I always ask …
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang leverages multiple AI chatbots, comparing their responses to gain comprehensive insights, similar to seeking multiple medical opinions. He tailors AI explanations to his understanding level, even requesting explanations as if he were a 12-year-old. Huang believes that interacting with AI enhances cognitive skills by requiring analytical thinking and reasoned questioning.

title: Monsoon Session: 'Centre open to Op Sindoor debate'; judge impeachment motion gains steam
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju announced the government's readiness to discuss key issues, including Operation Sindoor, in the upcoming Monsoon Session, emphasizing adherence to parliamentary rules and traditions. He highlighted the positive all-party meeting where leaders shared inputs for a successful session.

title: Travis Kelce goes solo in LA as Taylor Swift faces family emergency
content: Pop singer Taylor Swift is helping her father, Scott Swift, recover after heart surgery. Her partner, Travis Kelce, was seen driving in Los Angeles. Kelce is supporting Swift and her family during this time. He is also preparing for Kansas City Chiefs training camp. Kelce and his brother are pausing their podcast.

title: Dwyane Wade shows peaceful retreat after Kaavia’s ‘country girl’ moment
content: Dwyane Wade shares glimpses of his family moments. He posts videos of daughter Kaavia with a pony. Gabrielle Union is also seen in the video. Wade also shares a serene sea view from his vacation home. He emphasizes the importance of freedom for Kaavia. Wade and Union foster compassion and individuality in their parenting.

title: Shannon Sharpe’s $50 M assault suit settles; fans question his ‘guilty’ tag
content: Shannon Sharpe has settled a $50 million sexual assault lawsuit filed by a 20-year-old woman, raising questions among fans. While Sharpe's legal team affirmed a consensual relationship, the settlement has fueled speculation about his guilt. Both parties acknowledge a long-term, tumultuous relationship, leading to a mutually agreed-upon resolution and dismissal of the lawsuit.

title: Corey Adams Ole Miss football player shot and killed in tragic Memphis at age 18
content: Corey Adams, an 18-year-old Ole Miss freshman football player, tragically died in a Memphis shooting on Saturday night. Found in Cordova with a gunshot wound, he was pronounced dead at the scene. The former Edna Karr High School standout's death has left the Ole Miss and New Orleans communities in shock and mourning.

title: Team India bonds with Manchester United stars ahead of 4th Test
content: Ahead of the fourth Test against England, the Indian cricket team enjoyed a unique crossover event in Manchester, meeting players and staff from Manchester United. Stars from both sides exchanged jerseys, shared laughs, and participated in friendly football and cricket sessions.

title: Ayesha Curry launches Sweet July: Ice cream collab celebration
content: Ayesha Curry is celebrating the launch of her Sweet July Lip Treatment, the latest addition to her Sweet July Skin line. She marked the occasion with an Instagram post and a collaboration with San Francisco's Garden Creamery, resulting in two new ice cream flavors inspired by the lip treatment's tropical ingredients.

title: NPS vs UPS: What should government employees go for? Find out what works better
content: UPS vs NPS: Government employees now have until September 30 to choose between the New Pension System (NPS) and the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS), with clarification that both offer similar tax benefits. NPS, a market-linked option, suits younger individuals comfortable with risk, while UPS guarantees a minimum, inflation-indexed pension, ideal for those nearing retirement.

title: 'Everybody whispering': Travis Kelce likens romance to high school gossip
content: Travis Kelce addressed the rumours about Taylor Swift. It began after he tried to give her a bracelet at her concert. The media amplified the story. Kelce discussed the situation on The Pat McAfee Show. He humorously compared it to the game 'Telephone'. His podcast, New Heights, offered insights. The 'Traylor' effect boosted NFL viewership. Kelce became a cultural icon.

title: No Shubman, no Bumrah, no KL Rahul at nets ahead of must-win 4th Test
content: India's preparation for the crucial fourth Test against England faced disruption as rain forced the team indoors in Manchester. Key players like Shubman Gill and KL Rahul skipped the optional session. Concerns mount as fast bowlers Arshdeep Singh and Akash Deep face injuries, potentially sidelining them.

title: 'Interview on day Emergency was revoked': Jaishankar recalls UPSC journey
content: S Jaishankar recounted his UPSC interview experience coinciding with the revocation of the Emergency on March 21, 1977. He actively participated in the 1977 election campaign against the Emergency. This experience taught him the importance of clear communication under pressure and highlighted the potential disconnect between those in power and the public sentiment, which he termed the 'Lutyens' bubble'.

title: 'Saath ghoomna theek, par match nahi?': IND vs PAK called off
content: Former Pakistan pacer Abdur Rauf Khan criticized Indian players for their perceived hypocrisy regarding playing against Pakistan, highlighting the contrast between their off-field camaraderie and public stance.

title: ‘No one dares tell him’: Kushwaha backs Nishant; urges Nitish to hand over JD(U) reins
content: Upendra Kushwaha, an NDA ally, ignited political speculation on Nitish Kumar's son's birthday by suggesting a leadership transition within the Janata Dal (U). Kushwaha urged Nitish Kumar to consider handing over party responsibilities, claiming many in the party feel it's overdue. He warned that delaying the decision could cause irreparable damage.

title: EU curbs on Russian oil could hit India's $15bn fuel exports
content: The EU's new sanctions on Russian oil could jeopardize India's $15 billion fuel exports. These sanctions target refined petroleum products made from Russian crude, potentially restricting access to European markets.

title: Watch: Blaze engulfs packed Indonesian ferry; passengers forced to jump into sea
content: A fire broke out on an Indonesian ferry carrying nearly 300 passengers near Southeast Sulawesi on Sunday, causing panic and triggering emergency evacuations. The vessel was traveling from Kendari to Makassar when the flames erupted. At least 18 people sustained injuries, including burns and smoke inhalation, during the chaotic evacuation, but fortunately, no fatalities have been reported so far.

title: 'He was 11': Sangakkara reveals how RR found out about Vaibhav Suryavanshi - Watch
content: Rajasthan Royals discovered Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a batting prodigy, at just 11 years old. Kumar Sangakkara, impressed by his talent during trials facing international bowlers, highlighted his exceptional technique and powerful bat swing. Suryavanshi later became the youngest IPL player, showcasing his explosive batting with a remarkable 35-ball century.

title: Balcony drops, minors on lookout: How cops uncovered 'drug queen' Kusum's narco maze
content: In Delhi's Sultanpuri, Kusum, a 52-year-old drug kingpin, operated a sophisticated heroin racket from a covert hub disguised as four houses. She used rope-lowered baskets and window slits for drug deliveries, while juvenile lookouts and CCTV cameras provided security. Police finally breached the fortified structure, arresting her son Amit, who managed the daily operations, after months of surveillance.

title: Driving with children in car? Centre mulls 2x fine for breaking traffic rules
content: The road transport ministry is considering doubling penalties for traffic violations when children are present, aiming to enhance safety and accountability. A "merit and demerit" point system is also proposed, linking insurance premiums to driving behavior and potentially suspending licenses for excessive violations. Furthermore, drivers with traffic violations may face mandatory retesting upon license renewal.

title: 'The numbers don’t tell the whole story': Sanju Samson reflects on 10 years in international cricket
content: Sanju Samson celebrated 10 years in international cricket on July 19, 2025, marking the anniversary of his debut against Zimbabwe in 2015. While acknowledging that statistics don't fully capture his journey, he expressed gratitude for the experience.

title: ‘No words to express this feeling’ – Anshul Kamboj’s brother reacts to his India call-up | Watch
content: The Kamboj family is overjoyed as Anshul Kamboj, a 24-year-old Haryana pacer, earns a spot in India's Test squad against England, fueled by consistent performances and 79 first-class wickets.

title: Major trade pact, mending strained ties: What's on PM Modi's agenda during UK, Maldives tour
content: Prime Minister Modi is set to visit the UK and the Maldives from July 23-26, strengthening international ties. In the UK, he'll meet PM Starmer and King Charles III, aiming to sign a Free Trade Agreement. Subsequently, he will visit the Maldives as a guest of honor at their Independence Day celebrations.

title: Revealed! Rohit Sharma led India to Champions Trophy glory despite injury
content: Jatin Paranjape revealed that Rohit Sharma played through a hamstring injury during India's victorious ICC Champions Trophy campaign. Despite the injury, Rohit led the team to victory. Following his T20I retirement after the 2024 T20 World Cup, he also retired from Test cricket, though Paranjape felt he could have continued playing longer.

title: NDRF trains dogs to detect dead bodies: First cadaver unit to be commissioned; fills resue ops gap
content: NDRF is training dogs, primarily Belgian Malinois and Labradors, to locate human remains during rescue operations. This initiative addresses a gap in current disaster response capabilities, as the focus has traditionally been on saving lives. The dogs are being trained using a special synthetic scent mimicking human decomposition, as obtaining actual body material is challenging.

title: Army To Sponsor Education Of Boy Who Gave Meals To Troops During Operation Sindoor
content: The Indian Army on Sunday said it will bear the study expenses of a ten-year-old boy, who supplied little meals to soldiers battling gunfight in a Punjab village during Operation Sindoor.

title: Delhi Cops Bust Transnational Lottery Scam, 6 Including 2 Nigerians Arrested
content: Delhi Police has claimed to have busted a transnational cheating syndicate operating in Delhi-NCR with the arrest of six people, including two Nigerians, an official said on Sunday.

title: 4-Year-Old Girl Raped In UP, School Van Driver Arrested: Police
content: A van driver employed by a private school was arrested in connection with the rape of a four-year-old girl, a police official said on Sunday.

title: Video: Man Allegedly Had Liquor At Lucknow Restaurant. Then Crashed SUV Into It
content: A screeching sound of tyres pierces the night sky. It is followed by a crash right into the heart of a Lucknow eatery late on Saturday night, shows a video.

title: "He's Not With Us": Congress Leader After Shashi Tharoor's "Loyalty" Remark
content: Senior Congress leader K Muraleedharan on Sunday hit out at party colleague Shashi Tharoor again, saying that he will not be invited to any party programme in the state capital till he changes his stance on the national security issue.

title: New Hospitals, Flyovers Soon As Delhi Ramps Up Health, Transport Infrastructure
content: Delhi is ramping up its health infrastructure, with over 1,300 new hospital beds almost ready across four government hospitals, and the construction of seven hospitals with ICU facilities is underway in the city.

title: Drug-Addict Son Hacks Mother To Death After She Refused To Give Rs 20 In Gurugram: Cops
content: Refusing to give Rs 20 to her drug addict son cost a 56-year-old woman in Gururgam her life after he hacked her to death with an axe in rage, police said on Sunday.

title: "Accept The Truth": Ex Union Minister's Advice To Nitish Kumar On Son's Birthday
content: Upendra Kushwaha on Sunday urged Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar to take a firm decision in a 'timely manner', cautioning that any delay in this would lead to 'irreparable' damage to his party - the Janata Dal (United).

title: Spotlight On Manikrao Kokate: Crop Insurance Chaos To Rummy Video
content: Maharashtra's Agriculture Minister Manikrao Kokate finds himself at the centre of a controversy as a video surfaced that shows him apparently playing rummy on his phone while seated in the state assembly.

title: Crypto Platform CoinDCX Hacked, Nearly Rs 368 Crore Lost In Huge Security Breach
content: In a major security incident, CoinDCX, one of India's cryptocurrency exchanges, has confirmed a hacking attack that led to a loss of around $44 million (nearly Rs 368 crore).

title: Boy, 15, Sexually Assaulted By 2 In UP Was Forced To Lick Their Spit: Cops
content: Two youths were arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a boy, beating him up and making him lick their spit in a village here, police said on Sunday.

title: Astrologer Sexually Assaults 25-Year-Old Woman In Pune, Arrested: Cops
content: An astrologer has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a 25-year-old woman in Pune, police said on Sunday.

title: Heavy Rains Continue To Lash Kerala, "Orange Alert'' Issued In 9 Districts
content: Incessant rainfall across several parts of Kerala on Sunday led to rising water levels in rivers and dams, causing waterlogging in low-lying areas and prompting the IMD to issue an 'orange alert' for nine districts in the state.

title: Andhra Pradesh Liquor Scam: Chargesheet Mentions Jagan Reddy As Kickback Recipient
content: A chargesheet filed by Andhra Pradesh police in connection with the Rs 3,500 crore alleged liquor scam in a local court has mentioned Jagan Mohan Reddy as one of the recipients of the kickbacks averaging Rs 50-60 crore per month.

title: Video: Man Laughs As His Pit Bull Bites Child Inside Auto-Rickshaw In Mumbai
content: An 11-year-old boy was bitten by a Pit Bull after it was intentionally unleashed on him by its owner in Mumbai's eastern suburb.

title: "First Loyalty?" Shashi Tharoor's Big Remark Amid Rift With Congress
content: Amid his tussle with the Congress leadership over the public remarks in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack, senior party leader and MP Shashi Tharoor has dug his heels in

title: Iran Replaces Damaged Air Defences Post-Israel Conflict
content: Iran has replaced air defences damaged during last month's conflict with Israel, Iran's Defah Press news agency reported on Sunday quoting Mahmoud Mousavi, the regular army's deputy for operations.

title: Landmark Surgery May Pave Way For Legalising Broader Organ Exchange Model
content: In a groundbreaking medical feat, two men in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore have been given a new lease of life after undergoing India's first inter-hospital liver swap transplant - a move that required a special court order to override current rules.

title: "Has Rahul Gandhi Forgotten...": Minister's Jab Over Bihar Roll Revision
content: Union minister Pralhad Joshi hit back at the Congress today over the electoral roll revision in Bihar, saying the process of SIR (Special Intensive Revision) was started at the behest of Rahul Gandhi, who had written a letter about the discrepancies

title: "Will Cut You Up, Too": Man To Shopkeeper After Cutting Up Lehenga
content: A man, brandishing a knife, threatened a shopkeeper in Maharashtra that he would cut him up. Reason: a lehenga, which wasn't up to his soon-to-be bride's expectations.

title: If the College Football Playoff isn't broken, why fix it?
content: college football's opposition to an expanded, let alone expansive, playoff is dead and buried . the 81-year-old retired just this week after a second stint leading west Virginia University . plans to move from 12 participants to 16 were underway before last season's inaugural 12-teamer even took place .

title: How to approach potential Rashee Rice suspension
content: fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . fantasy managers should brace for the likelihood Rice will miss a noticeable portion of the 2025 season . the odds of him serving a multigame suspension have significantly increased .

title: Euro 2025 semifinals: How do you tactically beat each team?
content: the quarterfinals produced very exciting matchups at the 2025 edition of the women's Euros . the 2022 finalists, Germany and England , needed penalties to progress to the last four . but who will emerge victorious and make it to the final? Here are the strengths and weaknesses of the teams .

title: Why Drake Maye can be a top-10 QB in 2025
content: in 11 starts from Week 6 to Week 17, Drake Maye threw for 2,254 yards, 15 touchdowns and 10 interceptions . that translated to an average of 16.0 fantasy points per game in those starts, which would have ranked just outside the top 12 quarterbacks over a full season . Maye has all the makings of a top-10 fantasy quarterback .

title: How good is Usyk after his Round 5 KO of Dubois, and what next?
content: Oleksandr Usyk beats Daniel Dubois in round 5 at wembley stadium . the undisputed heavyweight king will go down in history as the best heavyweight for the past two decades . usyk can also be considered the best cruiserweight foe since lennox Lewis .

title: Our latest intel on trade deadline rumors, Tucker's free agency and more
content: the baseball world gathered in Atlanta for the 2025 MLB draft , home run Derby and all-star game this week . our reporters were there talking to execs, coaches, agents, scouts, players and other team sources .

title: WNBA All-Star grades: MVP Collier scores A+ in leading team to victory
content: team collier beats team Clark 151-131 at Gainbridge Fieldhouse . team captain caitlin Clark was sidelined by injury . the city of Indianapolis embraced hosting the game, and fans showed out in full force .
